scenario_text.value: Great, we made it back before sunset!
This is your uh, “skewl,” Takuma?

Not exactly. I go to a different school. This
is just the one we’re staying in for camp.
Still, I guess a school is a school...
But what IS a “skewl,” Takuma?
(Oh, uh... What IS a school, anyway?)

(I’ve never really thought about it...
I’m not sure how to answer.)

(Maybe with something a teacher would say?
No, no, I should say my real feelings...)
(Ah, but now’s not the time for this anyway!)
(How do I answer Agumon’s question?)
Focus on first aid.
Answer vaguely.
Answer directly.

I’ll explain that another time.
We need to find first aid.
Oh yeah! How’re ya holding up, Labramon?
I’m fine! This is nothing!

(She may say that, but I’m still worried. We
need to treat her soon.)

A school is a place for kids to become
adults, I guess.

You study, sure, but you learn about life,
friendships...all the important stuff.

Uh huh! So “skewl” is a good place to go if
you have any problems!
Yeah, you hit the nail on the head.

We go there to study, go to class, take
tests, the whole shebang.

“Klas”? “Tess”? “She-bang”? What the heck is
all that?!

Yes, yes, I’ll give you a rundown on all of
it later, okay?

Right now we’d better take care of Labramon.
Let’s head on inside.
...Wait, what? No one’s here.

And that’s not even the weirdest part...
Would ya just look at this place!
Yeah... Why is everything all so messed up?!

You think a huge earthquake tore through this
place while we were all passed out?
Oh, you passed out too, Minoru?
Yeah, and Aoi, too. But...

What in the world... What could have happened
here?!
That’s what I wanna know!

What’s the deal with this place...? And it’s
gonna get dark soon, right?

A school building at night would be freaky by
itself... But all beat up like this? Brrr...
Stop it... You’re scaring me!

Calm yourself, Minoru. Worry not, I’m right
here with you.
Yeah! And I’ll protect Aoi!

I wonder how long we were out? It couldn’t
have been more than an hour for me.
That sounds about the same as us, I think.

According to my phone’s clock, that seems
about right. The date hasn’t changed, either.

Even if it can’t connect to the network, the
time should still be right.

Then something must’ve happened in that short
amount of time, right?

A weapon of mass destruction, a natural
disaster...something like that?
Then how come this place is so overgrown?

...Good point. This doesn’t look like it was
destroyed. More like it fell apart over time.

I admit I am curious... But Labramon’s wound
takes higher priority now.
Anyway, let’s go inside!
